snippet: The Justice Department said the requirements for birth control coverage did not impose a “substantial burden” on an order of Roman Catholic nuns who challenged them.
abstract: Obama administration urges Supreme Court to reject lawsuit filed by the Little Sisters of the Poor, order of Roman Catholic nuns challenging requirements for many employers to provide health insurance coverage for birth control or face penalties under new health care law; Justice Dept says requirements do not impose 'substantial burden' on nuns’ exercise of religion because they can 'opt out' of the obligation.
lead_paragraph: The Justice Department said the requirements for birth control coverage did not impose a “substantial burden” on an order of Roman Catholic nuns who challenged them.

headline.main: Justices Are Asked to Reject Nuns’ Challenge to Health Law
headline.print_headline: Justices Are Asked to Reject Nuns’ Challenge to Health Law

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
